meanings.sent1: The caconymy of the character in the story confused the readers.
meanings.sent2: The teacher pointed out the caconymy in the student's essay.
meanings.sent3: The caconymy of calling a tomato a fruit made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His caconymy of the cat as a dog was quite amusing.
meanings.sent5: The caconymy of labeling the wrong button caused the machine to malfunction.

meanings.definition: The act of giving a wrong name or designation.
meanings.sent1: She apologized for the caconymy of her friend's name.
meanings.sent2: The caconymy of the street confused the delivery driver.
meanings.sent3: The caconymy of calling the boss 'mom' was embarrassing.
meanings.sent4: The caconymy of the plant as a tree was quite misleading.
meanings.sent5: The caconymy of the dish as 'spaghetti' was quite misleading.

meanings.definition: A term used to describe the incorrect naming of something.
meanings.sent1: The book explained the concept of caconymy in a simple way.
meanings.sent2: The caconymy of the new species puzzled the scientists.
meanings.sent3: The caconymy of calling the car a 'boat' was quite funny.
meanings.sent4: The caconymy of the painting as a photograph was striking.
meanings.sent5: The caconymy of labeling the wrong ingredient ruined the recipe.
